info.title: Kaizten Task REST API
info.description:
REST API used to define, store, access, and execute algorithms. The algorithms are entities that receive a set of input parameter values and return a set of output parameter values. These algorithms can be machine learning methods, optimization techniques, or simulation models, among others.
The API supports Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) for AJAX requests from any origin. The following header is included in the corresponding responses: Access-Control-Allow-Origin: *. You can read the CORS W3C Recommendation to learn more about CORS.
In the remainder of this documentation, it is assumed that the REST API is deployed in an IP and port denoted as IP and PORT, respectively.

tags.name: DataHander
tags.description: Data API, that use Minio as storage

get.description: It provides the information of the specified label.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the labels are included in the body of the response.

404.description: The lalbel with the given identifier is not found.

put.description: It updates a specific label by indicating its identifier (:id).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the label to update.

404.description: The label with the given identifier is not found.

200.description: The request has succeeded. The label is included in the body of the response.

delete.description: It deletes a label using its identifier (:id). The request returns the removed entity.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the label to delete.

404.description: The label to delete does not exist.

200.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one label being deleted. The deleted label is included in the body of the response.
OK

get.description: It provides a specific algorithm by indicating its identifier. The algorithm is provided in the response.

200.description: Found the algorithm

put.description: It updates an algorithm by specifying the fields to be modified.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the algorithm to be updated.

404.description: The algorithm with the given identifier is not found.

200.description: The request modifications are successfully updated.

delete.description: It deletes an existing algorithm by specifying its identifier. The deleted algorithm is provided in the response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the algorithm to be deleted.

404.description: The algorithm with the given identifier is not found.

200.description: The algorithm has been deleted successfully.
OK

get.description: It provides all the simulations models registered. The returned simulations models will be paginated to 20 items by default. Further pages can be requested by means of the page query paramenter. It can also set a custom page size up to 100 with the size parameter. It can also provides a list of simulations models which fit the specified filters.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the page to be returned. Default value: 20.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the simulations models are included in the body of the response.

post.description: It creates a new simlation model by specifying at least the required fields. The created simulation model is provided in the response.

200.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one simulation model being created. The new simulation model is included in the body of the response.

get.description: It provides an array containing all the labels.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the page to be returned. Default value: 20.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the labels are included in the body of the response.

post.description: It creates a new label by specifying its name.

201.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one label being created. The new label is included in the body of the response.

409.description: There is a label with the same name.

200.description: OK

get.description: It provides a list containing information about all the buckets.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the files are included in the body of the response.

post.description: It creates a new bucket. A summary of the bucket submitted is provided in the response.

201.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in a bucket being created. A summary of the submission of the new bucket is included in the body of the response.

get.summary: List all files in a bucket
get.description: It provides a list containing information about all the files in a specific bucket.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the files are included in the body of the response.

post.description: It creates a new file by specifying its content. A summary of the file submitted is provided in the response.

201.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in a file being created. A summary of the submission of the new file is included in the body of the response.

delete.description: It deletes a bucket using its identifier (:bucketName).

200.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one bucket being deleted. A summary of the deleted bucket is included in the body of the response.

404.description: The bucket to delete does not exist.

500.description: The bucket to delete does not empty.

200.description: OK

post.description: It creates or updates a file by specifying its content. A summary of the file submitted is provided in the response.

201.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in a file being created or updates. A summary of the submission of the new file is included in the body of the response.

post.summary: Create a new file in local storage
post.description: It creates a new file by specifying its content. A summary of the file submitted is provided in the response.

201.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in a file being created. A summary of the submission of the new file is included in the body of the response.

get.description: It provides all the algorithms registered. The returned algorithms will be paginated to 20 items by default. Further pages can be requested by means of the page query paramenter. It can also set a custom page size up to 100 with the size parameter. It can also provides a list of algorithms which fit the specified filters.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the page to be returned. Default value: 20.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the algorithms are included in the body of the response.

post.description: It creates a new algorithm by specifying at least the required fields. The created algorithm is provided in the response.

200.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one algorithm being created. The new algorithm is included in the body of the response.
OK

post.description: It executes a specific algorithm by indicating its name. The algorithm can receive parameter values in the body of the request in the following formats:

parameters.name: algorithmName
parameters.description: Name of the algorithm to execute.

404.description: The algorithm with the given name is not found.

400.description: If there is something wrong in the input parameters, it will be returned a BAD_REQUEST status with detailes about the errors.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the execution of the algorithm is queued. The information about the task created is provided in the response.

get.description: It provides all the tasks of the user if there is no filters specified, otherwise will be returned only those which fit the filters. The returned tasks will be paginated to 25 items by default. Further pages can be requested by means of the page query paramenter. It can also set a custom page size up to 100 with the size parameter.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Size of the page to be returned. Default value: 20.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the tasks are included in the body of the response.
OK

get.description: It provides a specific task by indicating its identifier. The task is provided in the response.

200.description: The request has succeeded. The task is included in the body of the response.

404.description: The task with the given identifier is not found.

delete.description: It deletes a specific task by indicating its identifier.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the task to be deleted.

404.description: The task with the given identifier is not found.

200.description: The request has succeeded. The task has been deleted.
OK

get.summary: Get a specific label by name
get.description: It provides the information of the specified label by name.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the labels are included in the body of the response.

404.description: The lalbel with the given identifier is not found.

get.description: It provides a specific file in a specific bucket.

200.description: The request has succeeded. The content of the file is included in the body of the response.

404.description: The requested bucket or file does not exist.

get.description: It provides a specific url to a specific object in a specific bucket.

200.description: The request has succeeded. The content the url is included in the body of the response.

404.description: The requested bucket or file does not exist.

get.summary: List all files in local storage
get.description: It provides a list containing information about all the files in localStorage.

200.description: The request has succeeded and the files are included in the body of the response.

delete.description: It deletes a file using its identifier (:name).

200.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one file being deleted. A summary of the deleted file is included in the body of the response.

404.description: The file to delete does not exist.

200.description: OK

get.description: It provides a specific algorithm by indicating its name. The algorithm is provided in the response.

200.description: Found the algorithm

delete.description: It deletes an existing simulationModel by specifying its identifier. The deleted simulationModel is provided in the response.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Identifier of the simulation-model to be deleted.

404.description: The simulationModel with the given identifier is not found.

200.description: The simulationModel has been deleted successfully.

delete.summary: Delete a specific file in a specific bucket
delete.description: It deletes a file using its identifier (:fileName) and (:bucketName).

500.description: The file to delete not exist in this bucket.

404.description: The bucket to delete does not exist.

200.description: The request has been fulfilled and has resulted in one file being deleted. A summary of the deleted file is included in the body of the response.
